# Reta Orçamentária

Column {.sidebar data-width=200}
------------------

```{r}

sliderInput("px",
            label = "Selecione o preço de x",
            min = 0.5,
            max = 3,
            value = 1,
            step = 0.1,
            dragRange = TRUE
            )

sliderInput("py",
            label = "Selecione o preço de y",
            min = 0.5,
            max = 3,
            value = 2,
            step = 0.1,
            dragRange = TRUE
            )

sliderInput("orcamento",
            label = "Selecione o orçamento total",
            min = 40,
            max = 100,
            value = 80,
            step = 5,
            dragRange = TRUE
            )
```


Column {data-width=800}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

### Desenhando a Reta Orçamentária

```{r}

renderPlotly({

price_x <- input$px

price_y <- input$py

total_budget <- input$orcamento

n_x <- total_budget/price_x

n_y <- round(total_budget/price_y, digits=2)

slope <- round(- n_y/n_x, digits=2)

budget <- function(x) (slope * x) + n_y

data_budget <- tibble(x=0:120,
               y=budget(x))

ro <- data_budget %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x,y)) +
  geom_line(size=1.5, color = "#e32d91")+
  theme_light()+
  # Make the axes go all the way to zero
  scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), breaks = seq(0, 100, 10)) +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), breaks = seq(0, 100, 10)) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, 100), ylim = c(0, 100))+
  labs(x="Unidades do bem X", y="Unidades do bem Y")+
  # Add a label
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 80, y = 51, 
           label = glue("A equação é: {n_y}{slope}x"), 
           color = "darkblue")

ggplotly(ro)
})


```

# Curvas de Indiferença

Column {.sidebar data-width=200}
------------------

A forma da curva de indiferença é : $U=kx^{a}y^{b}$

```{r}

sliderInput("k",
            label = "Selecione o coeficiente de k",
            min = 0.1,
            max = 3,
            value = 1,
            step = 0.05,
            dragRange = TRUE
            )

sliderInput("coefx",
            label = "Selecione o coeficiente de `a` de x",
            min = 0.1,
            max = 2,
            value = 1,
            step = 0.1,
            dragRange = TRUE
            )

sliderInput("coefy",
            label = "Selecione o coeficiente de `b` de y",
            min = 0.1,
            max = 2,
            value = 1,
            step = 0.1,
            dragRange = TRUE
            )

sliderInput("utilidade",
            label = "Selecione o valor de U",
            min = 10,
            max = 2000,
            value = 1500,
            step = 10,
            dragRange = TRUE
            )
```

Column {data-width=800}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

### Desenhando as curvas de indiferença

```{r}

renderPlotly({

coefx <- input$coefx

coefy <- input$coefy

k <- input$k

utility_y <- function(my_x, my_U) {
  my_U^(1/input$coefy)/(k^(1/coefy)*my_x^(coefx/coefy))
}

data_ci <- tibble(x=0:100,
                 U=input$utilidade,
                 y=utility_y(x,U))

indif_curva <- data_ci %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x,y)) +
  geom_line(size=1.2, color="darkblue")+
  annotate(geom = "text", 
           x = 50, 
           y = 5+utility_y(50,input$utilidade), 
           label = glue("U={input$utilidade}"), 
           color = "darkblue")+
  annotate(geom="text",
           x = 80,
           y= 51,
           parse = TRUE,
           label = glue("Função de Utilidade: U = {k}x^{coefx}y^{coefy}"),
           color = "darkblue")+
  labs(x="Unidades do bem X", y="Unidades do bem Y")+
  scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), breaks = seq(0, 100, 10)) +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), breaks = seq(0, 100, 10)) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, 100), ylim = c(0, 100)) +
  theme_light()

ggplotly(indif_curva)

})


```

### Maximização da Utilidade

```{r}

renderPlotly({
  
price_x <- input$ppx

price_y <- input$ppy

total_budget <- input$porcamento

n_x <- total_budget/price_x

n_y <- round(total_budget/price_y, digits=2)

slope <- round(- n_y/n_x, digits=2)

pcoefx <- input$pcoefx

pcoefy <- input$pcoefy

pk <- input$pk

budget <- function(x) (slope * x) + n_y

utility_y <- function(my_x, my_U) {
  my_U^(1/input$pcoefy)/(pk^(1/pcoefy)*my_x^(pcoefx/pcoefy))
}
  data_budget <- tibble(x=0:100,
               y=budget(x),
               U=input$putilidade,
    y_ci=utility_y(x,U))
  
  ro <- data_budget %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x,y)) +
  geom_line(size=1.5, color = "#e32d91")

max <- ro + geom_line(aes(x,y_ci),
                      size=1.5,
                      color = "darkblue")+
  annotate(geom = "text", 
           x = 35, 
           y = 5 + utility_y(30, input$putilidade), 
           label = glue("U={input$putilidade}"), 
           color = "darkblue")+
  labs(x="Unidades do bem X", y="Unidades do bem Y")+
  scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), breaks = seq(0, 100, 10)) +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), breaks = seq(0, 100, 10)) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, 100), ylim = c(0, 100)) +
  theme_light()

  ggplotly(max)
})

```
